text: Citroën Xantia was a car produced by Citroën. It replaced the Citroën BX in early 1993, with an estate version added in 1995 and a facelift at the end of 1997 and was replaced by the Citroën C5 in early 2001. It came in hatchback and estate bodystyles and was sold as a budget option towards the end of its run in France until 2002. == Engines == * 1.6i 65 kW (88 hp) * 1.8i 66 kW (90 hp) and 74 kW (101 hp) * 1.8i 16V 81 kW (110 hp) * 2.0i 89 kW (121 hp) * 2.0i 16V 97 kW (132 hp), 110 kW (150 hp) and 112 kW (152 hp) * 2.0i Turbo CT 108 kW (147 hp) * 3.0i V6 140 kW (190 hp) * 1.9 D 50 kW (68 hp) and 51 kW (69 hp) * 1.9 SD 55 kW (75 hp) * 1.9 TD 66 kW (90 hp) * 2.0 HDi 66 kW (90 hp) and 80 kW (109 hp) * 2.1 Turbo D12 80 kW (109 hp) == References == Category:1990s automobiles Category:2000s automobiles Xantia
title: Citroën Xantia
